block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.
FILM
Great Neck Furman Film Series: ''A Mighty Heart,'' directed by Michael Winterbottom. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $15. Clearview Squire Cinema, 115 Middle Neck Road. (516) 829-2570.

Southampton ''Rivers and Tides,'' a documentary about the sculptor Andy Goldsworth, directed by Thomas Riedelsheimer. Friday at 8 p.m. $7; members, $5. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
FOR CHILDREN
Brookville Big Apple Circus. Through June 10. $19 to $50. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.

Garden City ''Sandy Seashore Snapshots.'' Children create their own snapshot holder. Tuesday through Friday at 2:30 p.m. Free, with museum admission. Kids First! Film Club: ''Danny and the Dinosaur and More Friendly Monster Stories.'' Ages 3 and up. Friday at 4:30 p.m. $5; $3, members. Reel Fun at LICM: ''Happily N'ever After.'' Evildoers try to take over Fairy Tale land. Ages 3 and up. June 16 and 17. $3 with museum admission; $2, members. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.
Port Jefferson ''Billy Goat Gruff,'' children's theater. Through Monday. $8. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Riverhead ''Ancient Eggs,'' exhibition of fossilized dinosaur eggs. Through Sept. 3. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Bay Shore Spyro Gyra. Friday at 7 and 9:30 p.m. $40. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.

Great River Miller's Crossing Blue Grass Band. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Pat Wictor, guitarist. June 17 at 2 p.m. Free; $6 parking fee. Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park, 440 Montauk Highway. (631) 224-5420.
Hempstead Lainie Kazan in concert. Through June 10. $15 to $28. John Cranford Adams Playhouse, Hofstra University, South Campus. (516) 463-6644.
Oyster Bay Beethoven Festival; Robert Sherman of WQXR, host. June 10 at noon. $40. Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park, 1395 Planting Fields Road. (516) 922-9200.
Sag Harbor ''Strawberry Jazz,'' featuring the Hal McKusick Jazz Trio. June 10 at 2 p.m. $25; students, $15. Old Whalers Church, Union Street. (631) 725-0894.

St. James Philadelphia Saxophone Quartet, an afternoon of ragtime, jazz and swing music. June 10 at 4 p.m. $5. Spring Jazz Festival, featuring Dwayne Kerr. Friday at 8 p.m. $5. Spring Jazz Festival, featuring the Rob Ready Quintet. June 16 at 4 p.m. $5. Mills Pond House Gallery, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.
Southampton The Peconic Youth Orchestra. June 10 at 3 p.m. Free. Southampton Cultural Center, 25 Pond Lane. (631) 287-4377.
Upton Johnnyvolume plays a mix of Chicago and British blues. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $10. Brookhaven National Laboratory, County Road 46. (631) 344-3846.

Westbury 2007 Summer Concert Season: Chuck Berry and Johnny Rivers. Friday at 8 p.m. $51.50. Summer Doo Wop Extravaganza. June 16 at 8 p.m. $35. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
OUTDOORS
East Norwich ''Amazing Honey Bees,'' learn about bees from an expert bee-keeper. June 16, 10 a.m. to noon. Free. Muttontown Preserve, Muttontown Lane. (516) 571-8500.
Farmingdale Garden Festival 2007, includes workshops and more. June 10 at 10 a.m. Farmingdale State College. (631) 420-2113.

Garden City ''AirPlay,'' take part in an air race and navigate air mazes. Through September 2, Tuesdays through Fridays, at 10 a.m. $8 and $9. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington ''Literary Walk (Western Section),'' leisurely adult walk with readings from nature writings. June 10 at 11 a.m. $3; reservations required. ''Introduction to Wilderness Survival,'' learn how to find food, start a fire and build a shelter. June 17 at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.
Montauk Fourth Annual Montauk Harbor Festival, with wine, food, music and demonstrations. June 10 at noon. Montauk Harbor, West Lake Drive. (631) 668-2355.
SPOKEN WORD

Huntington Ben Tanzer speaks about his new novel ''Lucky Man.'' Monday at 8 p.m. Free. Ed Koch, co-author (with Christy Heady) of ''Buzz: How to Create It and Win With It.'' Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.

Northport Northport Historical Society's Speaker Series: Historians Joan O'Sullivan Lengyel and Orlando Lopes talk about neighborhood theaters. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. Northport Historical Society Museum, 215 Main Street. (631) 757-9859.

Roslyn Harbor Stars of Surrealism: ''The Flight of Imagination: Miró, Magritte and de Chirico,'' a lecture by the curator Franklin Hill Perrell. June 16 at 3 p.m. $15; $10, members. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Southampton ''Remembering Fairfield Porter,'' an informative evening about the painter, hosted by David Shapiro. June 16 at 6 p.m. $7; members, $5. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.

West Hills Marathon reading of Whitman's ''Song of Myself.'' Call (631) 427-5240 to sign up to read your favorite part. June 10 at 2 p.m. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.
THEATER
Bellport ''Cold As Ice,'' on-ice musical by Frank D'Agostino, performed by Oksana Baiul and other skaters. Through June 17. $39 to $43. Gateway Playhouse, 215 South Country Road. (631) 286-1133.
East Farmingdale Neil Simon's ''Oscar and Felix,'' presented by the Arena Players Repertory Theater. Through June 10. $18 and $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Elmont ''My Fair Lady,'' musical by Lerner and Loewe. Through June 23. $14 to $28. BroadHollow Theater, 700 Hempstead Turnpike. (631) 581-2700.
Hempstead ''Tess,'' a musical version of Thomas Hardy's ''Tess of the d'Urbervilles.'' Through June 17. $15 to $20. Spiegel Theater, Hofstra University. (516) 463-6644.
Lindenhurst ''Sideman'' by Warren Leight presented by BroadHollow Theater Company. Through June 24. $14 to $22. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.
North Merrick ''A Thurber Carnival,'' directed by Kathy Becker, presented by Lantern Theater. Through June 10. $13 and $15. Brookside School, 1260 North Meadowbrook Road. (516) 221-4485.
Oceanside The violinist Dara Shore's one-woman show weaves together classic Yiddish theater and music. Monday at 7 p.m. $5. Oceanside Jewish Center, 2860 Brower Avenue. (516) 536-6112.
Port Jefferson Bob Fosse's ''Sweet Charity.'' Through June 20. $20 to $28. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Quogue ''Léocadia,'' by Jean Anouilh, presented by Hampton Theater Company. Through June 17. $10 to $20. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
Sag Harbor ''The Night Season,'' by Rebecca Lenkiewicz, with Katherine Helmond. Tuesday through July 1. $50. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Bellport "Contrast and Harmony," work by LuAnn Thompson and Chris Taylor. Through June 30. Hours: Wednesday through Saturday, at 11 a.m. Phoenix Fine Art Gallery, 139 South Country Road. (631) 776-0811.
Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $3 and $4; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.
East Hampton ''Dan Flavin: An Intimate View,'' works from the late 1960's. June 16 through July 29. Reception: June 16 at 4 p.m. $4 and $5; members, free. Guild Hall, 158 Main Street. (631) 324-4050.

East Hampton Drawings by Linda Etcoff and Clifford Ross. Through July 9. Free. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Site Specifics '07,'' an exhibition of installations and mixed-media work. Through July 29. Reception: July 29 at 1 p.m. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Greenport ''Habitats,'' a benefit art show for Habitat for Humanity. Through June 24. Free. Hours: Fridays, 3 to 7 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. DeCordova Studio and Gallery, 538 Main Street. (631) 477-0620.

Greenport ''Dark/Stones/Standing,'' photography and photogravure by Barbara Yoshida and metal folk sculpture by Fritz Cass. Through July 5. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m. Sirens' Song Gallery, 516 Main Street. (631) 477-1021.
Holbrook Second Outdoor Art Show. June 10 at noon. Free. Sachem Public Library, 150 Holbrook Library. (631) 588-5024.
Huntington ''Vaux,'' works by Richard, Sandra and Joe Vaux. Through July 7. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.

Quogue ''Visual Poetry, Vivid Color,'' works of photorealism by Charles Wildbank. Through July 1. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.

Riverhead ''Duality,'' an all media art show. Through July 13. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. East End Arts Council Gallery, 133 East Main Street. (631) 727-0900.

Rockville Centre ''Irrevocable,'' works by graduating senior art students. Through June 30. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Roslyn Harbor ''Dreams on Canvas: Surrealism in Europe and America.'' ''Art to Touch,'' three-dimensional glass reproductions of works by Matisse, Marin and others. ''The Music of Regret and Other Works,'' photographs by Laurie Simmons. All through Aug. 12. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Sea Cliff ''Something Old, Something New, Vintage Wedding Gowns on View,'' gowns and accessories from the 1870's to the 1950's. Through July 4. $1. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 5 p.m. Sea Cliff Museum, 95 10th Avenue. (516) 671-0090.

Shelter Island ''M.A.L.E. (More Abstract Linear Expressions,'' paintings by Jason Willaford. Through June 18. Hours: Thursdays through Tuesdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Boltax.Gallery, 21 North Ferry Road. (631) 749-4062.
Southampton ''Three East End Photographers,'' large-format photos of the South Fork. Through June 25. Free. Hours: Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Bravura Art and Objects, 22 Nugent Street. (631) 259-2605.

Southampton ''Studio as Muse,'' three exhibitions that explore the artist's studio. Through Aug. 5. $5 and $7; children under 18, free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.

Stony Brook ''Living the American Dream: Levittown and the Suburban Boom,'' exhibition exploring the history of suburbanization on Long Island. Through July 8. ''William Sidney Mount: The Education of an Artist.'' Mount's paintings are paired with the works that inspired them. Through Sept. 30. $3 to $7. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.

Holbrook Second Outdoor Art Show. June 10 at noon. Free. Sachem Public Library, 150 Holbrook Library. (631) 588-5024.
Huntington ''Vaux,'' works by Richard, Sandra and Joe Vaux. Through July 7. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.

Quogue ''Visual Poetry, Vivid Color,'' works of photorealism by Charles Wildbank. Through July 1. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.

Riverhead ''Duality,'' an all media art show. Through July 13. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. East End Arts Council Gallery, 133 East Main Street. (631) 727-0900.
